Class SocketClientHandler

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.Network.Server.Socket.SocketClientHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
VirtualViewSocket, VirtualView
public class SocketClientHandler extends Object implements VirtualViewSocket

      server - the server instance associated with this client handler

      output - the output stream to send data to the client

    • runVirtualView

      public void runVirtualView() throws Exception
      Continuously listens for and processes messages received from a connected client through the input stream. This method is responsible for handling different commands based on the type of JSON input received and ensures the proper functionality of communication between the server and the client. The method processes the following types of inputs: - "setusername": Handles user registration by setting the username if it's available, or sends back an acknowledgment if the username is already taken or accepted. - "commandgiver": Executes commands received from the client using a specified command type and arguments. - "ping": Responds to the client's ping request by sending a pong message. - "pong": Updates the last recorded pong time to track communication status with the client. In case of an `EOFException`, the method releases resources by closing the input and output streams safely.
      Throws:
      Exception - if there is an issue with object reading or processing during execution.

    • getLastPongTime

      public long getLastPongTime()
      Retrieves the timestamp of the last received "pong" response.
      Returns:
      the timestamp of the last "pong" in milliseconds since the epoch.

    • error

      public void error()
      Sends an error message to the output stream. This method writes the string "error" to the synchronized output object and then flushes the stream to ensure the message is sent. In case of an I/O exception during the operation, it prints the stack trace of the encountered exception to the standard error stream. Thread Safety: This method uses synchronization to ensure thread-safe usage of the output stream.
      Specified by:
      error in interface VirtualView
      Specified by:
      error in interface VirtualViewSocket

    • ping

      public void ping() throws IOException
      Sends a "ping" message to the output stream. This method is synchronized to ensure thread-safe use of the output object.
      Specified by:
      ping in interface VirtualViewSocket
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during writing or flushing the message.

    • completeBuildingPhase

      public void completeBuildingPhase()
      Signals the completion of the building phase by writing a specific message ("completeBuildingPhase") to the output stream. This method ensures thread-safe access to the shared output resource by synchronizing on the output object. The message is serialized and flushed to the output stream. If an IOException occurs during this operation, the exception is caught and its stack trace is printed. This method overrides a superclass or interface method.
      Specified by:
      completeBuildingPhase in interface VirtualView
      Specified by:
      completeBuildingPhase in interface VirtualViewSocket

    • endbuilding

      public void endbuilding(String playerNickname, int positionwheretogo)
      Ends the building process for the specified player and provides the next position to proceed. The method sends information about the player's nickname and the target position, ensuring the synchronization of the output object to handle multi-threaded environments.
      Specified by:
      endbuilding in interface VirtualView
      Specified by:
      endbuilding in interface VirtualViewSocket

    • endBuildingPhaseForAll

      public void endBuildingPhaseForAll()
      Signals the end of the building phase for all participants. This method writes the message "endBuildingPhaseForAll" to the output stream and ensures the message is sent by flushing the stream. The operation is synchronized on the output object to provide thread safety. If an IOException occurs during the writing or flushing process, the exception is caught and its stack trace is printed. Implementation of this method should ensure that multiple threads do not concurrently access the output stream to avoid data corruption.
      Specified by:
      endBuildingPhaseForAll in interface VirtualView
      Specified by:
      endBuildingPhaseForAll in interface VirtualViewSocket

    • notEnoughGoods

      public void notEnoughGoods() throws Exception
      Notifies about the insufficient quantity of goods by sending a specific message ("notEnoughGoods") through the synchronized output stream. This method uses a synchronized block to ensure thread safety while writing to the output stream. It attempts to send the notification message and flush the stream. If an IOException occurs during this operation, it is caught and the stack trace is printed.
      Specified by:
      notEnoughGoods in interface VirtualView
      Throws:
      Exception - if any exception occurs during the execution of the method.
